messages.subject: Re: keyboard trix
messages.msgSnippet: woops!  so much for showing off my new keyboard savvy!!  for some reason it doesn t translate at all!  i really did find an impressive array of symbols
messages.messageBody:
woops! so much for showing off my new keyboard savvy!! for some reason it
doesn't translate at all! i really did find an impressive array of symbols
including the cents sign!!!! oh well, hope you can find it on your keyboard
anyway...
erin

messages.subject: RE: keyboard trix
messages.msgSnippet: There is no option key on PC keyboards. Hold the alt key, then press 0162 on the numeric keypad, release the alt key and you will get this: ¢ Even
messages.messageBody:
There is no "option" key on PC keyboards. Hold the "alt" key, then press
0162 on the numeric keypad, release the "alt" key and you will get this: �

Even easier, if you open the "system tools" folder (under "programs,
accessories in win95/98) you will see an icon for "Character Map." It will
let you easily view and select the printable characters for any font. You
can also run C:\WINDOWS\CHARMAP.EXE if you can't find the icon.

Billy

messages.subject: keyboard trix
messages.msgSnippet: deborah i found the key that does cents on my macintosh just because you asked, and i had been wondering myself!  even though i thought it would be ambiguous
messages.messageBody:
deborah
i found the key that does cents on my macintosh just because you asked, and i
had been wondering myself! even though i thought it would be ambiguous to
find in the manual, there it was under keyboard-- ha!
i just push option and 4 together to get it, drumroll please....
2�!!!! AND i can also do this:

much to my surprise!
:) thanks for encouraging my enlightenment...
erin
